sections.title: MBBS Admission in West Bengal 2025-26, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, cut-off and Counselling

content.content: West Bengal is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, West Bengal offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in West Bengal is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.

The MBBS curriculum in West Bengal spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.In West Bengal aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of MBBS seats in West Bengal can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. For MBBS Admission West Bengal 2025 total 10153 seats are available in Government and Private Medical Colleges in West Bengal. The state has 1 AIIMS College located in Kalyani, Nadia and 26 Government and 9 Private Medical Colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of MBBS admission for the academic year 2025-26 in West Bengal including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. For personalized assistance with MBBS admission in India or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at MBBS APP.

West Bengal has a total of 35 medical colleges, including 26 government medical colleges, 1 AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), 0 Deemed university and 9 private medical colleges. The government medical colleges offer 4553 MBBS seats, while the private medical colleges offer 5600 MBBS seats.

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

sections.title: Application Process for MBBS Admission West Bengal

content.content: For West Bengal MBBS Admission 2025-26, candidates can register themselves for counseling by visiting the official website of the Government of West Bengal, Department of Health and Family Welfare West Bengal. Registration requires candidates to provide their NEET 2025 Roll No., Application No., Date of Birth, and Security Pin, as well as their contact details (mobile numbers and email IDs). All applicants are required to submit a digital declaration, indicating that they meet the eligibility criteria and that all information provided is authentic.

Candidates will also need to specify their category (General, SC, ST, OBC, or PH) . Domicile holders and non-domicile holders will be issued different online slips, which will specify the time, date, and venue of the document verification round. Candidates must take a printout of this slip for reference and authentication.

Once all details have been filled in, candidates will be redirected to the payment page, where they can pay the West Bengal MBBS application fees via internet banking, credit, or debit card. Once payment is completed, a transaction ID will be displayed on the screen.

sections.title: West Bengal MBBS Admission 2025-26: Application Fees

content.content: Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of Government of West Bengal Department of Health & Family Welfare West Bengal during the registration window for each counselling round. Category wise application fee for West Bengal NEET UG Counselling is as follows:

sections.title: MBBS Admission West Bengal Eligibility Criteria 2025-26

content.content: The following are the eligibility criteria of West Bengal MBBS and BDS admission has mentioned below for candidates and that they need to check it.

content.list:
• Candidates should be a citizen of India & OCI.
  • The age of the candidates shouldn’t less than 17 years and will not be more than 25 years.
  • 5 Years’ Extention is allowed for the Reserve categories.
  • The candidate should have qualified marks in NEET UG to be eligible for admission to West Bengal MBBS 2025.
  • The candidate should have the residence proof of West Bengal State to urge admission here.
  • The candidate should be qualified in Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and English individually within the Class 12 final examination to be eligible for West Bengal MBBS admission 2025.
  • The candidate is additionally required to score in class 12 or equivalent examination, 50% marks or above taken together Physics, Chemistry, and Biology under UR category; 45% marks or above under PH category; 40% marks or above in SC/ST/OBC A or OBC B category.

sections.title: Document Required for MBBS Admission West Bengal 2025-26

content.content: Candidates are advised to bring the following original documents along with one set of photocopy for document verification on the day of counseling.

content.list:
• NEET 2025 Admit Card
  • NEET 2025 Rank Card
  • 10th Mark Sheet & Passing Certificate
  • 12th Mark Sheet & Passing Certificate
  • Category Certificate
  • Domicile Certificate
  • Character Certificate
  • Migration Certificate
  • Passport Size Photographs
